programme.title: My Name Is Sara
Mam na imię Sara
My Name Is Sara
programme.desc: My Name Is Sara: Directed by Steven Oritt. With Zuzanna Surowy, Konrad Cichon, Pawel Królikowski, Piotr Nerlewski. Sara is a a 13 year-old Polish Jew who finds refuge and is taken in by a farmer and his wife. She soon discovers the dark secrets of her employers' marriage, compounding the greatest secret she must strive to protect, her true identity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6819310/","name":"My Name Is Sara","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWU2ZjJhYmYtNGQxOS00MzYxLTlkYjctZWViYmFhYjE5Yzk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDQyNjQ0MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sara is a a 13 year-old Polish Jew who finds refuge and is taken in by a farmer and his wife. She soon discovers the dark secrets of her employers' marriage, compounding the greatest secret she must strive to protect, her true identi","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6819310/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sergius248"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Survival story amongst pesants","reviewBody":"The film portrays the survival story of young Sara, portrayed with subtle intensity by Zuzanna Surowy. Amongst the horrors of the Nazi occupation, and the ferocious Jews persecution in the Ukraine the protagonist manages to escape pretending to be a gentile. The peasant she shelters with are not good or altruistic, they are just downtrodden people, fiercely attached to their land and traditions. While the cinematography and the direction is passable but not memorable and the story line somehow mundane, probably the better aspect of the production reside in the depiction of the local peasant society, of their perennial straggle against whatever power exploit them and their self-reliance. People that cannot afford to be generous or open-minded. There are only few acts of genuine altruism and many more of the opposite but the unsentimental and non-judgmental approach to the storytelling is refreshing, leaving the viewer to make up its mind on the grey morality of the real world.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":422,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2020-02-27","keywords":"world war two,jewish refugee,polish jew,13 year old girl,child protagonist","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9160474/","name":"Zuzanna Surowy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9160475/","name":"Konrad Cichon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0472028/","name":"Pawel Królikowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649881/","name":"Steven Oritt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0639858/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0571591/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0385430/","name":"David Himmelstein"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 6819310, Title: My Name Is Sara, --- Description: My Name Is Sara: Directed by Steven Oritt. With Zuzanna Surowy, Konrad Cichon, Pawel Królikowski, Piotr Nerlewski. Sara is a a 13 year-old Polish Jew who finds refuge and is taken in by a farmer and his wife. She soon discovers the dark secrets of her employers' marriage, compounding the greatest secret she must strive to protect, her true identity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6819310/","name":"My Name Is Sara","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWU2ZjJhYmYtNGQxOS00MzYxLTlkYjctZWViYmFhYjE5Yzk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDQyNjQ0MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sara is a a 13 year-old Polish Jew who finds refuge and is taken in by a farmer and his wife. She soon discovers the dark secrets of her employers' marriage, compounding the greatest secret she must strive to protect, her true identi","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6819310/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"sergius248","dateCreated":"2020-04-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Survival story amongst pesants","reviewBody":"The film portrays the survival story of young Sara, portrayed with subtle intensity by Zuzanna Surowy. Amongst the horrors of the Nazi occupation, and the ferocious Jews persecution in the Ukraine the protagonist manages to escape pretending to be a gentile. The peasant she shelters with are not good or altruistic, they are just downtrodden people, fiercely attached to their land and traditions. While the cinematography and the direction is passable but not memorable and the story line somehow mundane, probably the better aspect of the production reside in the depiction of the local peasant society, of their perennial straggle against whatever power exploit them and their self-reliance. People that cannot afford to be generous or open-minded. There are only few acts of genuine altruism and many more of the opposite but the unsentimental and non-judgmental approach to the storytelling is refreshing, leaving the viewer to make up its mind on the grey morality of the real world.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":422,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2020-02-27","keywords":"world war two,jewish refugee,polish jew,13 year old girl,child protagonist","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9160474/","name":"Zuzanna Surowy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9160475/","name":"Konrad Cichon","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0472028/","name":"Pawel Królikowski"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649881/","name":"Steven Oritt"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0639858/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282373/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0571591/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0385430/","name":"David Himmelstein"],"duration":"PT1H51M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wino truskawkowe
Wino truskawkowe
programme.desc: Wino truskawkowe: Directed by Dariusz Jablonski. With Jirí Machácek, Zuzana Fialová, Marian Dziedziel, Mieczyslaw Grabka. This is not a love story though it is full of love. It is not a comedy though the characters often say funny things. It is not a detective story even though the hero is trying to solve a murder. It is not a nature drama though it shows the splendid colours and customs of the countryside. It is not a musical though Lubica expresses her longing in a passionate dance. Nor is it a film about ghosts though a ghost does ask the hero for a favour. A few draughts of Strawberry Wine are enough to take us into a magical world in the true centre of Europe, where love, crime and penitence are just as much a part of life as the changing of the seasons, the migration of birds or the flowing of a mountain stream." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1260596/","name":"Wino truskawkowe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTI5MjU4YjUtNGJkNy00Nzk2LTgyYWEtMDk0OTBmY2NmZTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTgyNDg0NTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is not a love story though it is full of love. programme.title: Nine Months
Dziewięć miesięcy
Nine Months
programme.desc: Nine Months: Directed by Chris Columbus. With Hugh Grant, Julianne Moore, Tom Arnold, Joan Cusack. When he finds out his longtime girlfriend is pregnant, a commitment-phobe realizes he might have to change his lifestyle for better or much, much worse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113986/","name":"Nine Months","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2U3YTQzYWYtZTBlYi00ZmJjLTkzMjAtOTljYmE5MThhNzk5L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When he finds out his longtime girlfriend is pregnant, a commitment-phobe realizes he might have to change his lifestyle for better or much, much worse.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113986/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"venom_701"},"dateCreated":"2003-08-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Argument For Sterilization","reviewBody":""Nine Months" is a predictable chick flick, where a very happy, content bachelor knocks up his live-in girlfriend, thereby turning his world upside-down. Lessons learned: men who don't want to marry and have children are portrayed as immature, self-absorbed, selfish, and misguided. Carting lots of screaming kids around in a minivan is, apparently, the most fun a man can have in this lifetime. For women, having children is the ultimate achievement and fulfillment of their lives. This is an insulting fairy tale that women will love, because it shows men who don't want marriage and kids as BAD and men who do want marriage and kids as GOOD. Women are always GOOD no matter what their attitude or actions are."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36120,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"1995-07-12","keywords":"time for title,bad dream,close up of eyes,close up of lips,close up of mouth","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Nine Months","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2812084505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjljYWMxZTUtNTQxYy00Yjc2LWI3MDEtYTNiYTQzMDZiMzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjljYWMxZTUtNTQxYy00Yjc2LWI3MDEtYTNiYTQzMDZiMzE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000424/","name":"Hugh Grant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000792/","name":"Tom Arnold"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0105317/","name":"Patrick Braoudé"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001060/","name":"Chris Columbus"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: The East
Ida
programme.desc:
The East: Directed by Zal Batmanglij. With Brit Marling, Alexander Skarsgård, Elliot Page, Toby Kebbell. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyNjQzMzg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjExNzU1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Emma_Stewart"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"An outstanding addition to Brit Marling's repertoire","reviewBody":"Since 2011's Another Earth landed at Sundance and nabbed the Special Jury Prize, Brit Marling has quickly cemented herself as one of the most exciting and challenging new talents. When she feels a genre hasn't been explored to its full potential, she takes it further. When she notices women her age are typecast in boring roles, she writes her own. She's a visionary filmmaker with something to say and the talent and ambition to make sure she's heard - her second collaboration with director and co- writer Zal Batmanglij, The East, is no exception, and is perhaps the peak of her already illustrious career so far. 

The film follows Jane Owen (Marling), an undercover security agent, as she leaves behind her doting boyfriend (Jason Ritter) to infiltrate an eco-terrorist group known as The East, who have publicly targeted massive corporations for their covered-up crimes against humans and nature. In between reports to her icy, amoral boss (Patricia Clarkson), Jane slowly grows fascinated with the group, its morals and goals, and its core (Alexander Skarsgard, Ellen Page, Shiloh Fernandez, Toby Kebbell), observing with a mix of horror and infatuation as they execute their violent "jams" on the corporations' key members. 

The East will inevitably draw comparisons to Sean Durkin's Martha Marcy May Marlene because of the subject matter and its ingenue leading lady.The East is not as much of a psychological profile, but there are interesting similarities - like Durkin, Batmanglij and Marling never really villainize or condemn their subects; instead, they make a point of showing the East's appeal. We, the audience, begin to understand why these troubled young people would find solace and purpose in what is essentially a band of guerrilla terrorists, and, in turn, why Jane is so hypnotized by them. It makes for an uncomfortably provocative watch: as we learn more about the characters, their backgrounds, and the corporations' crimes (which are based in fact), it's hard to determine who the "bad guys" are. I saw the film at a festival where Batmanglij gave a short Q&A after and he revealed that he, Marling, and Page had lived with similar groups (without the terrorism) before and were sympathetic with the East's cause, if not their methods. The sympathy shows in the writing and most of the time that's a good thing, but there are times when it gets closer to bias and muddies otherwise brilliant storytelling - but these are blips in the overall outstanding product. 

Marling is, as always, enigmatic and hypnotizing, but she is an observer and lets the other characters do the talking; it takes highly skilled actors to command empathy for villains and the cast doesn't disappoint. Alexander Skarsgard is incredibly charismatic and persuasive, and he fills in the blanks admirably whenever his development is cut short. Patricia Clarkson surprises in an unusual role for her - she hints that her character might be more evil than any of the terrorists she is hunting. Jason Ritter and Hillary Baack are affecting in their small roles, and Julia Ormond dominates her five minutes of screen time - her last scene is perhaps the most haunting in the film. Ellen Page gives a career-best performances and reminds us that she's a force to be reckoned with if only she were given the chance to show off more often. She commands the screen with intimidating animosity from the second she walks on screen and has some genuinely heartbreaking moments later on. 

In spite of occasional misfires, the screenplay is exceptional especially in its efficiency: there is so much going on that there isn't much time to devote to individual characters or relationships - Marling and Ritter's suffers the most - but Marling and Batmanglij make every second count as each line is weighted with enough subtext to tell us the stories implicitly and thoroughly nevertheless. The major characters are very well-drawn; even though we only get glimpses into Skarsgard, Page and Kebbell's pasts, we feel we know them inside and out. The film moves along at a fluid, adrenaline-pumping pace and the tension is genuine and organic rather than forced - the audience's investment in the story grows from affection for the characters and connection with their ideals rather than cheap editing tricks, manipulative music and stylized lighting or sound. Music is used so sparsely that when The National's "About Today" plays over a silent montage of Marling's character breaking down, its emotional weight surprises and stuns. The ending is comparatively underwhelming, but the overall package is one of the best, most provocative thrillers in years and firmly establishes Batmanglij and Marling as a sensational and important pairing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49468,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,public sex,nude swimming","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. IMDb data; ttnr: 1869716, Title: The East, --- Description: The East: Directed by Zal Batmanglij. With Brit Marling, Alexander Skarsgård, Elliot Page, Toby Kebbell. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyNjQzMzg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjExNzU1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Emma_Stewart","dateCreated":"2013-05-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"An outstanding addition to Brit Marling's repertoire","reviewBody":"Since 2011's Another Earth landed at Sundance and nabbed the Special Jury Prize, Brit Marling has quickly cemented herself as one of the most exciting and challenging new talents. When she feels a genre hasn't been explored to its full potential, she takes it further. When she notices women her age are typecast in boring roles, she writes her own. She's a visionary filmmaker with something to say and the talent and ambition to make sure she's heard - her second collaboration with director and co- writer Zal Batmanglij, The East, is no exception, and is perhaps the peak of her already illustrious career so far. 

The film follows Jane Owen (Marling), an undercover security agent, as she leaves behind her doting boyfriend (Jason Ritter) to infiltrate an eco-terrorist group known as The East, who have publicly targeted massive corporations for their covered-up crimes against humans and nature. In between reports to her icy, amoral boss (Patricia Clarkson), Jane slowly grows fascinated with the group, its morals and goals, and its core (Alexander Skarsgard, Ellen Page, Shiloh Fernandez, Toby Kebbell), observing with a mix of horror and infatuation as they execute their violent "jams" on the corporations' key members. 

The East will inevitably draw comparisons to Sean Durkin's Martha Marcy May Marlene because of the subject matter and its ingenue leading lady.The East is not as much of a psychological profile, but there are interesting similarities - like Durkin, Batmanglij and Marling never really villainize or condemn their subects; instead, they make a point of showing the East's appeal. We, the audience, begin to understand why these troubled young people would find solace and purpose in what is essentially a band of guerrilla terrorists, and, in turn, why Jane is so hypnotized by them. It makes for an uncomfortably provocative watch: as we learn more about the characters, their backgrounds, and the corporations' crimes (which are based in fact), it's hard to determine who the "bad guys" are. I saw the film at a festival where Batmanglij gave a short Q&A after and he revealed that he, Marling, and Page had lived with similar groups (without the terrorism) before and were sympathetic with the East's cause, if not their methods. The sympathy shows in the writing and most of the time that's a good thing, but there are times when it gets closer to bias and muddies otherwise brilliant storytelling - but these are blips in the overall outstanding product. 

Marling is, as always, enigmatic and hypnotizing, but she is an observer and lets the other characters do the talking; it takes highly skilled actors to command empathy for villains and the cast doesn't disappoint. Alexander Skarsgard is incredibly charismatic and persuasive, and he fills in the blanks admirably whenever his development is cut short. Patricia Clarkson surprises in an unusual role for her - she hints that her character might be more evil than any of the terrorists she is hunting. Jason Ritter and Hillary Baack are affecting in their small roles, and Julia Ormond dominates her five minutes of screen time - her last scene is perhaps the most haunting in the film. Ellen Page gives a career-best performances and reminds us that she's a force to be reckoned with if only she were given the chance to show off more often. She commands the screen with intimidating animosity from the second she walks on screen and has some genuinely heartbreaking moments later on. 

In spite of occasional misfires, the screenplay is exceptional especially in its efficiency: there is so much going on that there isn't much time to devote to individual characters or relationships - Marling and Ritter's suffers the most - but Marling and Batmanglij make every second count as each line is weighted with enough subtext to tell us the stories implicitly and thoroughly nevertheless. The major characters are very well-drawn; even though we only get glimpses into Skarsgard, Page and Kebbell's pasts, we feel we know them inside and out. The film moves along at a fluid, adrenaline-pumping pace and the tension is genuine and organic rather than forced - the audience's investment in the story grows from affection for the characters and connection with their ideals rather than cheap editing tricks, manipulative music and stylized lighting or sound. Music is used so sparsely that when The National's "About Today" plays over a silent montage of Marling's character breaking down, its emotional weight surprises and stuns. The ending is comparatively underwhelming, but the overall package is one of the best, most provocative thrillers in years and firmly establishes Batmanglij and Marling as a sensational and important pairing.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49468,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,public sex,nude swimming","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. ","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002907/","name":"Alexander Skarsgård","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0680983/","name":"Elliot Page"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074212/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2610231/","name":"Zal Batmanglij","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779870/","name":"Brit Marling"],"duration":"PT1H56M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Making of "Belfer. Sezon 2"
programme.desc: Publikacja najciekawszych materiałów z planu drugiego sezonu serialowego hitu. Realizatorzy filmu i aktorzy opowiadają o produkcji w niedługich wywiadach, które wzbogacone są ujęciami i kadrami z serialu.

programme.title: Miasta rytm: Zrabowane dzieła sztuki
programme.desc: W trakcie II wojny światowej z Polski zniknęły setki tysięcy bezcennych dzieł sztuki. Zarówno niemieccy, jak i radzieccy okupanci masowo wywozili obrazy i rzeźby. Nie wszystkie udało się odzyskać. Obecnie wiele z tych polskich zbiorów rozsianych jest po całym świecie. Historyk sztuki Jerzy S. Majewski przybliża losy tych zrabowanych dóbr. Snuje opowieść o skradzionym dorobku wielu wspaniałych artystów i wyjaśnia, co się z nim dokładnie stało.

programme.desc: Kulisy powstawania serialu "Król" w reżyserii Jana P. Matuszyńskiego. Produkcja stanowi ekranizację powieści Szczepana Twardocha o tym samym tytule.

programme.title: Listy do więzienia
The Letter Room
programme.desc: Dobroduszny, ale samotny Richard (Oscar Isaac) zostaje dyrektorem więzienia. Teraz musi przeglądać całą korespondencję osadzonych. Czytając ich listy, zaczyna bliżej poznawać prywatne sprawy podopiecznych. Interesuje się zwłaszcza skazańcem znajdującym się w celi śmierci. Postanawia podjąć działania, które wydają mu się słuszne.

programme.title: Na cenzurowanym
Master of the Classe
programme.desc: Berry (Sébastien Chassagne) ma 35 lat i dopiero niedawno dostał pracę jako stażysta w gimnazjum. Jego marzenie o stabilnym zatrudnieniu zostaje poddane próbie. Pewnego dnia ma się odbyć inspekcja jego lekcji, której wynik zadecyduje o tym, czy mężczyzna zdobędzie stałą posadę.

credits.actor: Sébastien Chassagne

programme.title: Prezent pod choinkę
Cadoul de Crăciun
programme.desc: Burzliwe polityczne przemiany grudnia 1989 roku opowiedziane z perspektywy konsekwencji pozornie niewinnego listu do Świętego Mikołaja. Wiadomość Mariusa (Luca Toma) sprawia, że życie jego ojca (Adrian Văncică) staje się koszmarem. Zaczyna on wzbudzać ciekawość sąsiadki oraz pracodawcy. Mężczyzna nie czuje się bezpieczny i wpada w panikę.

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

credits.actor: Karolina Kuszewska-Łukasik, Sasha Sidorenko, Sylwia Zaczkiewicz, Dominika Rembelska, Gabriela Kuzawińska, Ewa Piątkowska, Joanna Jędrzejczyk, Sylwia Kusiak, Magdalena Loska

programme.title: THE LEGENDS z Tomkiem Ćwiąkałą
programme.desc: Cykl wywiadów przeprowadzanych przez Tomka Ćwiąkałę z ważnymi postaciami ze świata futbolu. Wśród nich są mistrzowie świata, Europy i gwiazdy topowych lig. Widzowie dowiedzą się, czym zajmują się dzisiaj, jak wspominają swoje kariery oraz poznają ich plany na przyszłość.

programme.title: Zielona rewolucja Marty Dymek
programme.desc: Popularna blogerka Marta Dymek w każdym odcinku próbuje przekonać zaproszonego gościa do kuchni wegetariańskiej. Prowadząca pokaże, jak zastąpić potrawy mięsne ich jarskimi wariacjami.

programme.title: ABC gotowania - kuchnia włoska
programme.desc: Sztuka kulinarna we Włoszech opiera się na prostych potrawach przygotowanych z dobrych składników. Oliwa z oliwek, warzywa i zioła, sery, ryby, owoce morza, jajka, mąka i oliwki to podstawy wielu dań.

programme.title: David w Europie 5
programme.desc: Szef kuchni David Gaboriaud zabiera widzów w podróż po smakach Rumunii, Bułgarii, Serbii i Węgier. Prowadzący spróbuje regionalnych potraw i odwiedzi najciekawsze restauracje, bary oraz bistra. Oprócz tego przyrządzi dania, które będą jego interpretacją lokalnych potraw, a także sprawdzi się w charakterystycznych dla tamtych regionów aktywnościach fizycznych.

programme.title: Meblokreacje 4
programme.desc: Program udowadnia, że niewielkim kosztem i przy użyciu ogólnodostępnych materiałów można odnowić każdy stary mebel i uczynić z niego nietuzinkową ozdobę każdego wnętrza. W czwartym sezonie programu projektant wnętrz Artur Indyka pokaże m.in. jak wykorzystać stare ławy do urządzenia kawalerki, jak zaaranżować pokój we wschodnim stylu oraz jak wykonać żyrandol ze starych winyli. Podejmie się też zrobienia pomocy terapeutycznych do pracy z dziećmi i dorosłymi w świetlicy psychologicznej.

programme.title: Meblokreacje 4
programme.desc: Program udowadnia, że niewielkim kosztem i przy użyciu ogólnodostępnych materiałów można odnowić każdy stary mebel i uczynić z niego nietuzinkową ozdobę każdego wnętrza. W czwartym sezonie programu projektant wnętrz Artur Indyka pokaże m.in. jak wykorzystać stare ławy do urządzenia kawalerki, jak zaaranżować pokój we wschodnim stylu oraz jak wykonać żyrandol ze starych winyli. Podejmie się też zrobienia pomocy terapeutycznych do pracy z dziećmi i dorosłymi w świetlicy psychologicznej.

programme.title: Pogotowie remontowe Wieśka 3
programme.desc: Wiesiek Skiba, doświadczony specjalista budowlany, naprawia usterki zgłoszone przez widzów. Usuwa szkody powstałe w wyniku działań nierzetelnych fachowców i udziela praktycznych wskazówek. W kolejnym sezonie ekspert kończy kładzenie glazury, osadza drzwi, montuje okap, wymienia baterie łazienkowe, a nawet poprawia ułożenie paneli.

programme.title: 60 kilo niczego
programme.desc: Krzysztof Kowalik (Grzegorz Damięcki) zaczyna nowy dzień pracy na stanowisku kierownika kopalni kruszców. Żeby zyskać posłuch, zamierza sprawować bezwzględne rządy. Kiedy dochodzi do nieszczęśliwego wypadku, jego moralność zostaje wystawiona na próbę.

programme.title: Spitsbergen
programme.desc: Magda (Magdalena Czerwińska), zawieszona ratowniczka medyczna, otrzymuje nagłe wezwanie. Oznacza to dla niej powrót do dramatycznych wydarzeń i ludzkich tragedii. Gdy opada poziom adrenaliny, kobieta przypomina sobie podróże na Spitsbergen - mroźną norweską wyspę na Morzu Arktycznym. To miejsce stało się dla niej powodem traumy, z którą do tej pory nie zdołała się uporać. Przerastają ją cudze nieszczęścia i własna przeszłość.

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
Mój kuzyn Vinny
My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc:
My Cousin Vinny: Directed by Jonathan Lynn. With Joe Pesci, Ralph Macchio, Marisa Tomei, Mitchell Whitfield. Two New Yorkers accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college call in the help of one of their cousins, a loudmouth lawyer with no trial experience." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0104952/","name":"My Cousin Vinny","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxNDYzMTg1M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzk4MDgxMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two New Yorkers accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college call in the help of one of their cousins, a loudmouth lawyer with no trial experience.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0104952/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Barky44"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliant Film!","reviewBody":"My Cousin Vinny is one of the most brilliant comedies ever produced. There is simply so much to love about this movie.

First, this is not simply a slapstick comedy. Sure, there is some of that, including a few hilarious moments in the Alabama mud. But the dialogue in this film is terrifically funny. The writers were able to turn a courtroom script into an incredibly funny exchange of dialogue between lawyers, judges and witnesses. And the whole idea of an out-of-work hairdresser knowing about Positraction is simply brilliant.

This dialogue is brilliant because of excellent performances by both Marisa Tomei and Joe Pesci. These two sell this whole load of nonsense so beautifully it should be mandatory viewing for first-year drama students. These two actors show how talented people can read practically anything and make it not only funny but wholly believable.

Even all the side characters, from the judge to the D.A. to the defendants to the jury and witnesses are brilliantly played. Some of the exchanges between a local Alabama judge and a NYC poser lawyer would be completely ridiculous in anyone else's hands, but these people make it so real and so funny it's truly a thing of beauty.

This is one of those rare films that I can watch over and over again for hours and not tire of it.

10 out of 10 Barky","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":114262,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1992-03-13","keywords":"lawyer,trial,italian american,alabama,jail","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"My Cousin Vinny","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2744844569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc2NWI4YjctMWVhMy00MGViLTk5NzQtZGMwYWY3MzQwZWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc2NWI4YjctMWVhMy00MGViLTk5NzQtZGMwYWY3MzQwZWZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000582/","name":"Joe Pesci"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000673/","name":"Marisa Tomei"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001494/","name":"Ralph Macchio"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0528718/","name":"Jonathan Lynn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057987/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0731057/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0490958/","name":"Dale Launer"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Tenis: Turniej WTA w Ostrawie
programme.desc: Polska ukazana z niezwykłej perspektywy - z lotu ptaka. Tym razem twórcy starają się przede wszystkim uchwycić na swoich zdjęciach najróżniejsze królewskie zamki obronne, magnackie pałace oraz szlacheckie dwory i dworki. Oprócz samych fotografii zostanie przedstawiona także porywająca historia losów właścicieli tych lokacji. Widzowie zobaczą także wnętrza opisywanych twierdz i dworów.

programme.title: Sleeping with the Enemy
Sypiając z wrogiem
Sleeping with the Enemy
programme.desc:
Sleeping with the Enemy: Directed by Joseph Ruben. With Julia Roberts, Patrick Bergin, Kevin Anderson, Elizabeth Lawrence. A young woman fakes her own death in an attempt to escape her nightmarish marriage, but discovers it is impossible to elude her controlling husband." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0102945/","name":"Sleeping with the Enemy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzMzN2MxZDQtZjA0YS00ZTIzLThkYjktYzA0ZDIzOTAxMGQyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young woman fakes her own death in an attempt to escape her nightmarish marriage, but discovers it is impossible to elude her controlling husband.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0102945/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Mr_PCM"},"dateCreated":"2008-07-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Industry standard thriller only raised by Roberts' presence","reviewBody":"One of many standard thrillers that were scattered through the late 80s and early 90s, many of which would star Julia Roberts, and which showed her to be more than just the pretty romantic lead. Here she plays a much stronger character, a woman fleeing her abusive husband to start a new life, strong, independent but still skittish, worried that she might be found.

A tale of beautiful but terrified housewife Laura(Roberts) who resorts to desperate lengths to escape the constant fear of her violent and controlling husband martin (Patrick Bergin) in which she lives  faking her own death to be able to begin a new life far away. However, finding little peace she is still haunted by her previous life, a life which inevitably catches up with her when her husband discovers she is still alive and attempts to track her down.

Roberts can do the strong independent woman role in her sleep and make it appear effortless - a fact proved later with her Oscar win for Erin Brockovich - and in Sleeping with the Enemy she shows the early talent which would eventually lead her to that Oscar win. Meanwhile Bergin is suitably menacing in a rent-a-villain kind of way, all grimacing and intense staring. He does however have a rather interesting tic  a form of OCD- towels all neatly lined up and so on  which could have served as a rather effective tension builder had it been given further development.

However the film itself, while entertaining and diverting enough in its' own right, there is still something very standard and formulaic about the plot. For far too much of the film's (admittedly short) 94-minute runtime we seem to be waiting for the film to get going, and the climax arrives far too late and is too short, wasting the tension which has been built up. In addition, Kevin Anderson as Ben, the white knight who should rescue Laura from her fear, just does not seem to gel with the part  coming off as slightly creepy himself rather than a hero, particularly in the early half of the film.

Overall Sleeping With The Enemy remains a standard typical early 90s thriller of which there were so many, no better or worse than any of the others. A curio for fans of Julia Roberts wishing to see her earlier career development in an effective performance, but the average plot makes the film a throwaway thriller which could serve for a Saturday evening's entertainment with a bottle of wine, but little more. Reasonable, serviceable but forgettable.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":53735,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1991-02-08","keywords":"domestic violence,borderline personality disorder,faked death,abusive husband,villain not really dead cliche","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2371272217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VlZTg3NzYtYjEzNi00MGE1LTg1MGEtYmYxYjk4MDAxZjA0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VlZTg3NzYtYjEzNi00MGE1LTg1MGEtYmYxYjk4MDAxZjA0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000920/","name":"Patrick Bergin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000754/","name":"Kevin Anderson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0747849/","name":"Joseph Ruben"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0697067/","name":"Nancy Price"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0060103/","name":"Ronald Bass"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

Predator
programme.desc:
Predator: Directed by John McTiernan. With Arnold Schwarzenegger, Carl Weathers, Elpidia Carrillo, Bill Duke. A team of commandos on a mission in a Central American jungle find themselves hunted by an extraterrestrial warrior." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0093773/","name":"Predator","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QwYmFmZTEtNzY2Mi00ZWMyLWEwY2YtMGIyNGZjMWExOWEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwNzk3NDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A team of commandos on a mission in a Central American jungle find themselves hunted by an extraterrestrial warrior.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0093773/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Anonymous_Maxine"},"dateCreated":"2004-11-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Welcome to the jungle, baby","reviewBody":"Consider that so many of the roles that Arnold Schwarzenegger takes on are so similar, including Predator, and yet this film is so much better than most of the others. I enjoy watching his movies just because he's such a watch-able guy, even in his bad movies (which are many), but I think the thing that really makes Predator stand out is its simplicity. The movie starts, the guys get dropped in the jungle, lots of blood and carnage flies across the screen, and the movie simply ends. No romance, no complex back story, no soldier struggling with problems in his past or even trauma caused by the horrible things he experiences during the movie. This is one of the things that made First Blood so good. It may turn out to be a movie about a lot of muscle-bound meatheads in the woods, but it doesn't insult the audience or try to apply complexity to a story that can't support it.

Interestingly, the movie features two eventual governors. Jesse Ventura even wrote a book which was released while he was the governor of Minnesota and he used his favorite line in this movie as the title. And the book's actually pretty interesting; there are some funny stories in it about things that went on while they were filming this movie. Arnold, on the other hand, is actually (and thankfully) given a relatively small amount of stupid one-liners, which are an idiotic byproduct of hard action movies that I've never really understood the necessity for. They don't reveal anything about the characters who say them, they don't add to the story or further the plot, and with rare exceptions, they're not funny. But I guess comic relief has to come from somewhere, and since complexity is not a requisite for movies like this, I can't really expect a lot of thought being put into the comedic content either.

I watched Predator having never seen it from beginning to end and having just re-watched the original Alien. I am currently in the process of re-watching both series', for obvious reasons. One thing that I notice about both of them is the way they take their time in introducing the enemies which, in both films, are aliens. Predator doesn't waste much time dwelling on the origin of the alien, we pretty much assume it came from a space ship that flashed across the screen at the opening of the movie. Alien, on the other hand, went into remarkable detail about where its alien came from. What Predator does do, very effectively, I think, is that it has the guys fighting some very human enemies, which allows the movie to later take its sweet time in having them realize that the new enemy is not human at all. This is also, incidentally, weakly rehashed in the sequel, using the secrecy of this mission and team as an excuse to have more guys who don't know what's going on.

The death scenes are actually pretty tasteful, given the genre. They are just gory enough to illustrate the violence of the enemy without being gratuitous. Just enough is shown to show how vicious the alien is, and there are some strange things done to and with the bodies that make you wonder about the alien's intentions or needs. The first deaths suggest vengeance if not some sort of ritual, but later ones suggest that the alien may be feeding off of his (or her) victims. Oddly enough, it is not until the awful Predator 2 that we learn that it kills for sport.

Yes, the movie occasionally gets embarrassingly macho, but the skill with which it is put together far overshadows any tough-guy goofiness. Consider, for example, the ease with which the movie switches from showing the guys hunting the alien to their realization that they are the ones being hunted. In some cases, this transition takes place during a single shot and with virtually no movement in the shot at all except a change in someone's expression. It is truly a fight between a group of predators, which we understand because they are human like us, and a single predator whose powers and weaknesses are unknown. It's not Oscar material, needless to say, but it's a great action movie in part because it already knows that.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":387026,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1987-06-12","keywords":"jungle,survival,hunting people,commando,predator","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Predator","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1686176025","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhN2FjZDYtOTExNC00N2NkLTk0M2MtMjA0ZWFmMDM3OWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDNhN2FjZDYtOTExNC00N2NkLTk0M2MtMjA0ZWFmMDM3OWU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000216/","name":"Arnold Schwarzenegger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001835/","name":"Carl Weathers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001310/","name":"Kevin Peter Hall"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001532/","name":"John McTiernan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0041635/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019968/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0859029/","name":"Jim Thomas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0859049/","name":"John Thomas"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: W spirali
W spirali
programme.desc: W spirali: Directed by Konrad Aksinowicz. With Piotr Stramowski, Katarzyna Warnke, Olga Boladz, Antoni Królikowski. An out of town car trip, which was meant to have a purifying effect on the trouble-stricken married couple, turns into a dangerous interaction between characters when they pick up an eccentric traveler, Tamir. Tamir is a witness to, and a catalyst of their problems, a self-appointed healer wishing to become their path to enlightenment. Krzysztof and Agnes know they shouldn't be together but they are unable to part, or perhaps they do not want to? "Into the Spiral" is a story of love which is restless, dangerous and toxic." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4092514/","name":"W spirali","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWY3M2NjNWMtNzY3MC00NGY3LWJiNTMtMWEyZTBmZjc4OGJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjY0OTk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An out of town car trip, which was meant to have a purifying effect on the trouble-stricken married couple, turns into a dangerous interaction between characters when they pick up an eccentric traveler, Tamir. programme.desc: Stealing Harvard: Directed by Bruce McCulloch. With Jason Lee, Tom Green, Leslie Mann, Megan Mullally. A middle-class man turns to a life of crime in order to finance his niece's first year at Harvard University." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0265808/","name":"Stealing Harvard","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZhMGIyNGMtN2NmYy00OTBhLWE3NWQtMGQ3ZmNmZGUwMDg1L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A middle-class man turns to a life of crime in order to finance his niece's first year at Harvard University.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0265808/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MLDinTN"},"dateCreated":"2003-09-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"a silly comedy that works","reviewBody":"Call me crazy, but I liked this movie. programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
Noc w muzeum: Tajemnica grobowca
Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb
programme.desc:
Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian: Directed by Shawn Levy. With Ben Stiller, Amy Adams, Owen Wilson, Hank Azaria. Security guard Larry Daley infiltrates the Smithsonian Institution in order to rescue Jedediah and Octavius, who have been shipped to the museum by mistake." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1078912/","name":"Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGZjZDE2NjUtMzVkNy00N2UyLTg5MjYtYzY1ZmM1YWY3ZTZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Security guard Larry Daley infiltrates the Smithsonian Institution in order to rescue Jedediah and Octavius, who have been shipped to the museum by mistake.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1078912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bjohnt"},"dateCreated":"2009-05-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Exceeded my Expectations","reviewBody":"When I saw the trailer for this, I was pretty excited. I loved the whole premise of the first one, and having a sequel opened up whole new opportunities. I was excited when I saw all these famous characters from history being mashed together, Al Capone, Napoleon Bonaparte, Amelia Earhart, to name a few. 

I walked into the theater not expecting to much, but when I left I was very happy with it. They handled every characters personality beautifully, and the inside jokes were hilarious. I don't want to give much away, but trust me, you'll laugh. It tackles many themes like, a house divided cannot stand, the way to happiness is doing what you love, don't dwell on the past, etc. For a family flick they handle this jumbled cast of characters with complex personalities amazingly. They threw away most of the characters from the first movie to make way for the newer characters, which I didn't like that much, but how many characters can you throw in a story to have it make sense?

This film is an amazing example of a movie made for kids and adults. Kids will enjoy the silly humor, and the monkey. While adults will laugh at the onslaught of in-jokes, and trust me, there's a lot.

All in all, this was a great movie, blew me away. The highlight for me was Hank Azaria, that lisp kills me every time.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":185025,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2009-05-20","keywords":"al capone character,darth vader character,theodore roosevelt character,abraham lincoln character,albert einstein character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian -- Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1663697689","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODE1MDI2NTk1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTAyNjkxMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODE1MDI2NTk1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTAyNjkxMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Security guard Larry Daley infiltrates the Smithsonian Institute in order to rescue Jedediah and Octavius, who have been shipped to the museum by mistake."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001774/","name":"Ben Stiller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005562/","name":"Owen Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0010736/","name":"Amy Adams"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506613/","name":"Shawn Levy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0158853/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046151/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0304830/","name":"Robert Ben Garant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0502073/","name":"Thomas Lennon"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Norm of the North: King Sized Adventure
Misiek i chiński skarb
Norm of the North: King Sized Adventure
programme.desc: Norm of the North: King Sized Adventure: Directed by Richard Finn, Tim Maltby. With Alan Marriott, Andrew Toth, Brian Dobson, Cole Howard. An ancient Chinese artifact has been stolen by a villainous archaeologist named Dexter. With the help of his Lemming friends, Norm must keep his word and embark on a journey across the world to help recover the artifact for the people of China." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9428190/","name":"Norm of the North: King Sized Adventure","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjMwZDhhZWYtOTM0OC00ZTQzLWIyNDktNDM1NmVkYTY4NWNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTYyNDUxMDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ancient Chinese artifact has been stolen by a villainous archaeologist named Dexter. With the help of his Lemming friends, Norm must keep his word and embark on a journey across the world to help recover the artifact for the peopl","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9428190/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jeremycrimsonfox"},"dateCreated":"2019-06-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Seriously? Another one?","reviewBody":"Wow, if Keys To The Kingdom was not bad enough, Lionsgate actually has the nerve to give us a second sequel, and it's just as bad. The plot is basically Norm finds a human named Jin who crashed in the Artic trying to keep a Chinese artifact out of the hands of Dexter, a villainous archeologist. Jin has Norm promise if he does not make it, to take the artifact to his grandson, Chen, in Beijing, having Norm go on a quest while also keeping his promise to do his grandfather's wedding. Also, there's a B story where Quinn is acting king to help with wedding preparations, and he acts like a total jerk to everyone.\n\nWhile the movie tries to teach kids a moral about keeping promises, it does not do well. The Lemmings are a bad rip-off of Chip and Dale, the B story is horrible and adds nothing to the plot, only being there to force the moral down our throats, and the humor is not funny. Your kids deserve better animated films than this garbage, so if you are a parent, steer clear of this king size abomination and buy something from Disney or Warner Bros.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":385,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.2},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2019-08-02","keywords":"norm of the north character,polar bear,bear,chinese artifact,artifact","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Norm of the North: King Sized Adventure","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3224222745","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDVmMTRmOTUtOGRiYi00Njc0LWE5NmItNGQ4NmJmYTNhMDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDVmMTRmOTUtOGRiYi00Njc0LWE5NmItNGQ4NmJmYTNhMDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1166199/","name":"Alan Marriott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1418935/","name":"Andrew Toth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0229889/","name":"Brian Dobson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2529521/","name":"Richard Finn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1207195/","name":"Tim Maltby"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0548903/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0584939/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0497984/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0824900/","name":"Dean Stefan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1662741/","name":"Daniel Altiere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1662742/","name":"Steven Altiere"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

Another one?","reviewBody":"Wow, if Keys To The Kingdom was not bad enough, Lionsgate actually has the nerve to give us a second sequel, and it's just as bad. The plot is basically Norm finds a human named Jin who crashed in the Artic trying to keep a Chinese artifact out of the hands of Dexter, a villainous archeologist. Jin has Norm promise if he does not make it, to take the artifact to his grandson, Chen, in Beijing, having Norm go on a quest while also keeping his promise to do his grandfather's wedding. Also, there's a B story where Quinn is acting king to help with wedding preparations, and he acts like a total jerk to everyone.\n\nWhile the movie tries to teach kids a moral about keeping promises, it does not do well. The Lemmings are a bad rip-off of Chip and Dale, the B story is horrible and adds nothing to the plot, only being there to force the moral down our throats, and the humor is not funny. Your kids deserve better animated films than this garbage, so if you are a parent, steer clear of this king size abomination and buy something from Disney or Warner Bros.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":385,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.2,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2019-08-02","keywords":"norm of the north character,polar bear,bear,chinese artifact,artifact","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Norm of the North: King Sized Adventure","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3224222745","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDVmMTRmOTUtOGRiYi00Njc0LWE5NmItNGQ4NmJmYTNhMDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDVmMTRmOTUtOGRiYi00Njc0LWE5NmItNGQ4NmJmYTNhMDU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1166199/","name":"Alan Marriott","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1418935/","name":"Andrew Toth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0229889/","name":"Brian Dobson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2529521/","name":"Richard Finn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1207195/","name":"Tim Maltby"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0548903/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0584939/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0497984/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0824900/","name":"Dean Stefan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1662741/","name":"Daniel Altiere","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1662742/","name":"Steven Altiere"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.title: Antoinette dans les Cévennes
Osiołek, kochanek i ja
Antoinette dans les Cévennes
programme.desc: Antoinette dans les Cévennes: Directed by Caroline Vignal. With Laure Calamy, Benjamin Lavernhe, Olivia Côte, Marc Fraize. Antoinette, a school teacher, is looking forward to her long planned summer holidays with her secret lover Vladimir, the father of one of her pupils. programme.title: Kiler
Kiler
programme.desc: Kiler: Directed by Juliusz Machulski. With Cezary Pazura, Malgorzata Kozuchowska, Jerzy Stuhr, Janusz Rewinski. An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0127626/","name":"Kiler","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDRkNWMxYWEtODUwMC00ZDRjLWI0MmQtMjFjNTFiMDYwZDZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0127626/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cjpok"},"dateCreated":"1999-06-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lots of action with funny twists","reviewBody":"This could easily be called the Polish version of "Pulp Fiction" but thank God, it is not. It is captivating from the very get-go, keeping the viewing audience as hostage to the very end. Although unique in style and approach, it is universal and could appeal to any audience, anywhere in the world. Humorous and tastefully prepared.No wonder Hollywood already bought rights to the story. We may see it on this side of the pond. I hope without Bruce Willis or other Hollywood screen "heroes". This story deserves better!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6505,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1997-11-17","keywords":"character name as title,serial murder,surname as title,one word title,police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668640/","name":"Cezary Pazura"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0469021/","name":"Malgorzata Kozuchowska"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0836136/","name":"Jerzy Stuhr"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532702/","name":"Juliusz Machulski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093411/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093398/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0921264/","name":"Piotr Weresniak"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
Kupiliśmy zoo
We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc:
We Bought a Zoo: Directed by Cameron Crowe. With Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson, Thomas Haden Church, Colin Ford. Set in Southern California, a father moves his young family to the countryside to renovate and re-open a struggling zoo." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1389137/","name":"We Bought a Zoo","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MTE3OTUwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODg5NjgwNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in Southern California, a father moves his young family to the countryside to renovate and re-open a struggling zoo.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1389137/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"wbhendrix-1"},"dateCreated":"2011-11-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful & Touching, Crowe does it again.","reviewBody":"Cameron Crowe never fails to deliver hart warming drama-comedies that make you laugh, cry and keep you on the edge of your seat for duration of his films. For me personally, I never seem to agree with Crowe's casting taste (Matt Damon and Scarlett Johansson never do much for me) but Cameron has a way with actors and a true vision for his story. He always seems to know exactly who can capture his characters and ultimately draw out your emotions that he's tugging at. 

In We Bought a Zoo, there is a bit of a slow start and at one point I was worried Cameron had lowered his voice to appeal to a larger audience to please producers and critics alike (after his Critically-bombed but personal all time fav, Elizabethtown). 

But let me tell you, pay your dues with the first half of this film because the second half will take you on a mesmerizing cinematic adventure you'll be heartbroken for more. Cameron ventures into a new family drama without compromising his voice, music taste or quality film making. And if you are still not a huge CC fan, the animals are sure to win you over. Their beautiful and natural moments on screen are as breath taking as they are tear-jerking.

Spend an amazing two hours with this film and there won't be a person in your household that won't agree that this film is one to remember. From a fan and living-room-critic, I give it two thumbs up :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":138994,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2011-12-23","keywords":"based on true story,zoo,inspection,tween girl,2010s","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi592747545","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzI1NDc2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTgwMDg2Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzI1NDc2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTgwMDg2Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father moves his young family to the countryside to renovate and re-open a struggling zoo. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000354/","name":"Matt Damon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424060/","name":"Scarlett Johansson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002006/","name":"Thomas Haden Church"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001081/","name":"Cameron Crowe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0299664/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0112459/","name":"Aline Brosh McKenna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001081/","name":"Cameron Crowe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3349167/","name":"Benjamin Mee"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Love, Weddings & Other Disasters

Love, Weddings & Other Disasters
programme.desc:
Love, Weddings & Other Disasters: Directed by Dennis Dugan. With Maggie Grace, Diane Keaton, Jeremy Irons, Dennis Dugan. It is a multi-story romantic comedy about the people who work on weddings to create the perfect day for a loving couple - while their own relationships are outlandish, odd, crazy and far from perfect." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10235718/","name":"Love, Weddings & Other Disasters","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA5NzRjMDktMzc0My00NDdkLThlN2YtNDZiYjM3MGVkY2M4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"It is a multi-story romantic comedy about the people who work on weddings to create the perfect day for a loving couple - while their own relationships are outlandish, odd, crazy and far from perfect.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10235718/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ts-0000"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Why the hate?","reviewBody":"Was it perfect? Lol-Not at all.

However did have overall parts,that made it watchable.

Casting was decent,most of the storylines & cinematography too."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1451,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-12-04","keywords":"couple","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4041982233","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFjNTQxNGEtMjEzNS00ZjI1LTg1OTYtOTRlNmI0NzNkY2YwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFjNTQxNGEtMjEzNS00ZjI1LTg1OTYtOTRlNmI0NzNkY2YwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Maggie Grace (Taken) and Oscar® winners Diane Keaton and Jeremy Irons lead this warmhearted romantic comedy. With a couple’s impending wedding as the backdrop, Love, Weddings & Other Disasters weaves multiple storylines as it follows the search for love by a colorful group of characters including: an inexperienced wedding planner (Grace) nicknamed “The Wedding Trasher”; a fussy celebrity caterer (Irons); his blind date (Keaton); and a tour-bus guide (Andrew Bachelor) looking for his Cinderella. How their lives and loves intersect is half the fun in this film that proves romance is alive and well… and as crazy as ever!"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1192254/","name":"Maggie Grace"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000473/","name":"Diane Keaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000460/","name":"Jeremy Irons"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240797/","name":"Dennis Dugan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0754311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0447556/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0810439/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174885/","name":"Eileen Conn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240797/","name":"Dennis Dugan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588777/","name":"Larry Miller"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Z odzysku
Z odzysku
programme.desc:
Z odzysku: Directed by Slawomir Fabicki. With Antoni Pawlicki, Nataliya Vdovina, Jacek Braciak, Dimitri Melnichuk. 19 year old Wojtek lives in a poverty stricken Polish town. He is in love with an older woman, an illegal emigrant from Ukraine. He boxes in illegal matches to get money and is spotted by a man running a security business. Accepting this man's offer means becoming a gangster, but this could allow him to a residence permit for his girlfriend Katya." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0800275/","name":"Z odzysku","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDAwYmI3NGMtZTJhOS00NDQ4LWIwN2EtZjFmYjA4ODQ0MDg4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"19 year old Wojtek lives in a poverty stricken Polish town. He is in love with an older woman, an illegal emigrant from Ukraine. He boxes in illegal matches to get money and is spotted by a man running a security business. Accepting ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0800275/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sclerozo"},"dateCreated":"2008-12-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Weak and shallow plot and result is a dismal movie","reviewBody":"I was unlucky to see this movie at the Toronto International Film Festival and now by chance I came across it on IDMB. I was hoping it might have been a movie I missed and after realizing what it is I decided to post my comment.

I can't believe how this pathetic movie garnered some awards as it appears to have. The plot is banal and approaches stupid as the unconvincing downfall of this man is portrayed. Somehow the director tries to portray that hard work will get you nowhere in post-communist Poland and the attachment with a gang lifestyle also leads to a calamity. The ending is so abrupt and unexpected that it leaves the audience wondering whether the film reel missed a splicing. 

I would like to watch a Polish movie worthy of the time to see it and this one falls so far behind that and I truly regret the wasted time.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":359,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2006-11-17","keywords":"fall from height,accident,kissing,male female relationship,marriage proposal","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2252397/","name":"Antoni Pawlicki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891502/","name":"Nataliya Vdovina"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102765/","name":"Jacek Braciak"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0264614/","name":"Slawomir Fabicki"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043688/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147152/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0264614/","name":"Slawomir Fabicki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367885/","name":"Denijal Hasanovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2256587/","name":"Marek Pruchniewski"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jestem Andrzejem
programme.desc: Marek, introwertyczny informatyk po trzydziestce, próbuje odnaleźć się w szalonym świecie swojej młodszej dziewczyny Julki. W wyniku kłótni para się rozstaje. Marek samotnie wraca do domu, przechodząc przez ulicę zostaje śmiertelnie potrącony przez samochód. W ten sposób trafia do zaświatów. Dzięki pomocy tajemniczego chłopaka udaje mu się wrócić do żywych.

programme.title: Aktualności filmowe+
programme.desc: W cotygodniowym programie zostają przedstawione najbardziej interesujące wydarzenia ze świata kina. Pojawiają się wywiady z osobami związanymi z branżą filmową, prowadzone są rozmowy na temat premier, nowości muzycznych i teatralnych.

programme.title: Le prince oublié
Mój książę z bajki
Le prince oublié
programme.desc:
Le prince oublié: Directed by Michel Hazanavicius. With Omar Sy, Bérénice Bejo, François Damiens, Sarah Gaye. Every night as Sofia falls asleep, her father Djibi takes her into "Storyland", a fantasy film studio where their extraordinary fairy-tale adventures come to life starring Djibi in the lead role as the heroic Prince Charming." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8335482/","name":"Le prince oublié","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTJiZWEyNDMtNWNjOC00ZGJhLWExZjYtOTRhZmNlNjg0YzEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA3MzQ4MTc0._V1_.jpg","description":"Every night as Sofia falls asleep, her father Djibi takes her into "Storyland", a fantasy film studio where their extraordinary fairy-tale adventures come to life starring Djibi in the lead role as the heroic Prince Charming.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8335482/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jimimhendrix-31103"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wonderful story about the circle of life","reviewBody":"8/10. I gave it a 10 because I think the current 5.1 is way too low

The story follows a single father very dedicated to provide a happy growing up experience to his daughter by way of storytelling. All is well until teenhood interferes, so both father and daughter have to learn to handle it :-)

The costumes in the story world are bright and happy. The real life story is honest but also positive.

I personally did not find anything wrong with the movie, it's message, its direction, its acting, etc.

The only reason I think it's an 8/10 is because of me: I'm a grown up and not a parent. Still I rated it 10/10 because I don't understand the current 5.1 rating. Who hurt you? :D","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1104,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2020-02-12","keywords":"night","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [English SUB]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3936402969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM5ZGU3M2QtMjMyYS00NDJlLTgyZGUtN2I4NmMxYjliYmYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM5ZGU3M2QtMjMyYS00NDJlLTgyZGUtN2I4NmMxYjliYmYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1082477/","name":"Omar Sy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0067367/","name":"Bérénice Bejo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1460782/","name":"François Damiens"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371890/","name":"Michel Hazanavicius"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0775436/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1315212/","name":"Bruno Merle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4380548/","name":"Noé Debré"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371890/","name":"Michel Hazanavicius"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="
